key_points: President Joe Biden signed the American Rescue Plan Act, authorizing a third stimulus check.
More than 156 million of these payments have been distributed by the IRS.
Individuals who haven't received their third check can check the IRS's Get My Payment tool.
To claim the first or second stimulus checks, individuals must file their 2020 taxes.
Line 30 of the 1040 (or 1040-SR) form is used to request any unpaid stimulus payments.
The IRS provides worksheets and tax-filing software to help calculate the amount owed.
To claim unpaid funds, individuals must know how much they have received and how much they are entitled to.
The IRS will send a letter if there is a discrepancy between the claimed and calculated amounts.
Stimulus payment adjustments could result in a larger tax refund or reduce outstanding IRS bills.
The deadline to file 2020 taxes and claim unpaid stimulus funds is extended until May 17, 2021.
